0.title: Sehwag trolls Pak conspiracy theorist Zaid for mistaking Neeraj Chopra with Ashish Nehra
0.article_body: Virender Sehwag trolled Pakistani conspiracy theorist Zaid Hamid for mistaking Neeraj Chopra with Ashish Nehra. In a tweet praising Arshad Nadeem for winning gold at CWG, Zaid claimed Nadeem beat Nehra. "Chicha...Nehra is right now preparing for UK PM elections...So Chill," Sehwag wrote. "Neeraj (or as per him Nehra) participated at CWG. This is latest news!" a user tweeted.

1.title: Daughters of PMO workers tie rakhi to PM Modi, video surfaces
1.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Rakshabandhan with the daughters of PMO workers at his residence in Delhi. In a video shared by the PMO, the young girls are seen tying rakhi to PM Modi, some are also seen seeking his blessings after touching his feet. They are the daughters of the sweepers, peons, gardeners and drivers employed at the PMO.

2.title: US regulators deny broadband subsidies to SpaceX's Starlink, LTD
2.article_body: The US Federal Communications Commission (FCC) rejected Elon Musk-run SpaceX's Starlink and LTD Broadband's applications to receive more than $2 billion in internet service subsidies through a rural fund, the FCC said on Wednesday. The FCC further said that both Starlink and LTD Broadband gave inadequate answers to questions and are not capable of complying with commission requirements.

3.title: Akshay & I have a unique tuning to deliver meaningful films: Bhumi
3.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that actor Akshay Kumar has been a huge part of her acting career. "We have a unique tuning to deliver some meaningful films," she said. Speaking of 'Toilet: Ek Prem Katha' and 'Raksha Bandhan', Bhumi said that both the films can be watched with the family and deliver a message.

4.title: Go Fashion plans to open 120-130 stores every year
4.article_body: Go Fashion, the owner of women’s clothing brand Go Colors, reported a profit after tax (PAT) of ₹24.4 crore for the quarter ended June. It also said that it was working on expanding the brand across geographies by adding about 120-130 stores every year. Its total revenue surged to ₹165.2 crore from ₹31 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal.

5.title: Suspected militants attack jail in DR Congo, free over 800 prisoners
5.article_body: More than 800 prisoners have escaped after armed men attacked a prison in eastern DR Congo, authorities said on Wednesday. Fighters of the Allied Democratic Forces, a group linked to the Islamic State group, are being blamed for the jailbreak. Two police officers and a civilian were killed and part of the facility was damaged by a fire during attack.

6.title: Zerodha's Kite app faces technical snag in early trade
6.article_body: Stockbroking platform Zerodha’s mobile app Kite faced a technical snag as the markets opened on Thursday morning with several users taking to social media to complain about the same even as #zerodhadown trended on Twitter. The company shared an update at 9:21 am on its website to inform that the issue with its Kite mobile app had been resolved.

7.title: Just a phase: Maha minister on Nitish forming govt with RJD-led Grand Alliance
7.article_body: Maharashtra minister and Shiv Sena rebel camp leader Deepak Kesarkar has said that JD(U)'s alliance with the RJD-led Grand Alliance is "just a phase". He added, "JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar may reconsider his decision if he feels that he has picked the wrong party. That's not unprecedented." Nitish took oath as Bihar CM for the eighth time on Wednesday.

8.title: Noida-based startup SquadStack raises $17.5 mn in Series B round
8.article_body: Sales acceleration startup SquadStack has secured $17.5 million in a series B funding round led by Bertelsmann India Investments. The funding round saw participation of existing investors Chiratae Ventures and Blume Ventures. The Noida-based startup which was established in 2017, aims to use funds to hire more employees and increase its sales experts base.

9.title: Gurugram club manager, 6 bouncers arrested for beating up guests
9.article_body: At least six bouncers and the manager of Gurugram's club Casa Danza in Udyog Vihar have been arrested, police said. This comes after the accused allegedly beat up a manager of a multinational company and his friends for opposing the alleged molestation of their female friend. An argument had broken out between the bodyguards and the men, police added.

10.title: Several Chinese cities expand fresh restrictions amid COVID outbreak
10.article_body: Several Chinese cities imposed fresh restrictions and lockdowns to contain COVID-19 outbreak. Authorities in the manufacturing hub Yiwu, home to 1.9 million people, have announced three days of "silent management" in which some residents are confined to their homes and most are banned from leaving designated areas. People can step out for COVID-19 tests, grocery shopping and hospital visits.

11.title: What a joke, I had no desire of becoming VP: Nitish Kumar
11.article_body: Refuting the claim that he wanted to become country's Vice President, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "You heard a man say…I wanted to be the Vice President. What a joke! It's bogus. I had no such desire." On Wednesday, BJP's Sushil Kumar Modi alleged Kumar dumped NDA as his ambition of becoming country's Vice President couldn’t be accommodated by BJP.

12.title: She'll win gold in 2024 Olympics: Telangana Sports Minister on Sreeja
12.article_body: Telangana Sports Minister V Srinivas Goud said Sreeja Akula, who alongside Sharath Kamal helped India win its first-ever table tennis mixed doubles gold at CWG, during CWG 2022, will win gold in the 2024 Paris Olympics. "We went into the mixed doubles competition without enough practice sessions because of the tight schedule," Sreeja had said after the mixed doubles gold.

13.title: Hindu family saves Muharram procession from fire near slain Kanhaiya Lal's shop in Udaipur
13.article_body: A Hindu family in Udaipur helped avoid a tragedy after a fire broke out on a 'tajiya' during Muharram procession near murdered tailor Kanhaiya Lal's shop. Ashish Chowadia, Rajkumar Solanki and their family members poured water on 'tajiya' from their balconies till the flames were doused, police said. "This incident has won everyone's heart," District Collector Tara Chand Meena said.

14.title: I would rather lose than win on a false promise: UK PM hopeful Sunak
14.article_body: UK's Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak said he'd rather lose the Tory leadership race to replace Boris Johnson than "win on a false promise". Sunak, in an interview with BBC, said he'd tell people what "they needed to hear" and stay "true" to his values. Sunak added that he's committed to helping the most vulnerable families with the cost-of-living crisis.

15.title: Civil Aviation Minister reacts after influencer seen smoking inside SpiceJet flight
15.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has reacted after an influencer was seen smoking inside a SpiceJet flight. "Investigating it. There will be no tolerance towards such hazardous behaviour," Scindia said. Authorities have filed a police case against the influencer named Balvinder Kataria who had travelled from Dubai to New Delhi.

16.title: Babar Azam can become no. 1 batter in Test cricket: Mahela Jayawardena
16.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena has said Pakistan captain Babar Azam can dethrone Joe Root as the number one Test batter in the near future. "Babar has been consistent in all three formats and it shows in his rankings. He's a naturally gifted player...he's got the game to adapt as well," stated Jayawardena. Babar is currently ranked third in Tests.

17.title: Was told 'You've to do something now': Akshay on last 2 films not working
17.article_body: Discussing the failure of his last two films 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Samrat Prithviraj', actor Akshay Kumar said, "People came...to me and said...'You have to do something now'." Producer Aditya Chopra, who produced 'Samrat Prithviraj', had reportedly blamed the actor's lack of "commitment". Reacting to such reports, Akshay had stated, "My eight hours are equal to 14-15 hours of other stars."

18.title: Central Railway adds Vistadome coach in Pune-Secunderabad Shatabdi Express
18.article_body: Central Railway has decided to add a Vistadome coach in Pune-Secunderabad Shatabdi Express, an official said. "Passengers will enjoy Ujani backwaters and dam near Bhigwan...relish the beauty of the forest as it traverses through Ananthagiri Hills," the official added. This would be Central Railway's fifth Vistadome coach which was first introduced in 2018 on Mumbai-Madgaon Janshatabdi Express.

19.title: 42 Malian soldiers killed, 22 injured in suspected militant attack
19.article_body: Forty-two Malian soldiers were killed and 22 others were injured in an attack near Tessit town on Sunday, Mali's government said on Wednesday. "The Malian army...reacted vigorously to a complex and coordinated attack by armed terrorist groups, presumably from Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS), characterised by the use of drones, explosives, car bombs and artillery," the government added.

20.title: Nadal set to return to competitive tennis at Cincinnati Open
20.article_body: Twenty two-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal is set to return to competitive tennis at Cincinnati Open, which will begin on August 13. Nadal hasn't played since pulling out of the Wimbledon 2022 semi-final against Australia's Nick Kyrgios due to an abdominal tear. Nadal is the only one among the 'Big Three' who will participate at Cincinnati.

21.title: Kajal recreates scene from 'Baahubali' with son Neil for Rajamouli
21.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal took to Instagram Stories and recreated a scene with her son Neil from SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali'. In the picture, Kajal put Neil's feet on her head. "Rajamouli sir, this is Neil's & my dedication to you. How could we not," Kajal wrote along with the picture. Kajal and Rajamouli have previously worked together in 'Magadheera'.

22.title: Speak about darkness you've spread: Surjewala on PM's 'black magic' remark
22.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's "black magic" remark, Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "Instead of cursing the Opposition, speak about the darkness you have spread too." Surjewala tweeted a video of PM Modi and wrote, "Dark clouds of back-breaking inflation! Dark clouds of unprecedented unemployment! Dark clouds over the sinking economy...Dark clouds hovering over stalling industries!"

23.title: Cried for the 1st time after hearing film's narration: Kareena on 'Laal...'
23.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor said she "cried" after listening to the narration of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', marking the first instance of her crying following a film's narration, in her career. "[It's] such a beautiful story," added Kareena. Actor Aamir Khan stated that he has not been able to sleep for the past one month due to stress over the film's release.

24.title: Eicher Motors shares clock 52-week high a day after Q1 results
24.article_body: A day after Eicher Motors reported a 157.5% jump in consolidated profit after tax (PAT) at ₹610.66 crore y-o-y for the quarter ended June, its shares opened over 3% up on Thursday clocking a 52-week high. The company sold 1,86,032 Royal Enfields in the quarter, which is a 52% rise from 1,22,170 motorcycles sold in the corresponding period last fiscal.

25.title: Woman dies after falling off 3rd floor in Delhi's Shakurpur; husband held
25.article_body: A 21-year-old woman died after falling off the third floor of her in-laws' house in Delhi's Shakurpur following which her husband was arrested, police said. This comes after her family raised the issue of her bad health with the in-laws which led to a quarrel, police added. The incident happened when the deceased's mother went to a police station.

26.title: Pak only care about the 2-3 games vs India, not Asia Cup: Ex-player Tauseef
26.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Tauseef Ahmed said Pakistan "don't really care" about the upcoming Asia Cup 2022. "We only care about those two-three games against India. It's like 'If we win these, that's it'," added Tauseef. "When something this crucial comes up, you go back to those players about whom you once said that they should leave cricket," he stated.

27.title: UP Police constable complains about food quality in public, breaks down; video surfaces
27.article_body: A video of a UP Police constable crying and complaining about the quality of the food served to the personnel is being widely shared online. In the video, constable Manoj Kumar said, "We're served such rotis after 12-hour duty...throw them to dogs, can your children have it?" Police, however, said Kumar faced disciplinary action on 15 occasions in recent years.

28.title: Singapore's GDP grows 4.4%, growth projections for 2022 downgraded
28.article_body: Singapore's gross domestic product (GDP) grew 4.4% year-on-year in the second quarter, the Ministry of Trade and Industry (MTI) said. It is lower than the 4.8% growth seen in the government's advance estimate. The government downgraded its growth projections for 2022 owing to cost pressures and global outlook risks because of the Russia-Ukraine war.

29.title: Pakistani woman's 'Should I kill my kids?' video goes viral amid rising prices
29.article_body: A Pakistani woman's video is going viral in which she is seen slamming the government after skyrocketing inflation. "What should I do, pay house rent, hefty electricity bills, purchase milk and medicines for my kids, feed my children or should I kill them?," she said in the video. "The government has almost killed the poor people," she further said.

30.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar takes oath as 14th Vice President of India
30.article_body: Former West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar took oath as the 14th Vice President on Thursday. President Droupadi Murmu administered the Oath of Office to Dhankhar at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Dhankhar clinched 528 votes and defeated Opposition nominee Margaret Alva, who bagged 182 votes in the Vice Presidential election.

31.title: Iraqi actress to sue The Economist over her photo in story about 'fat' Arab women
31.article_body: Iraqi actress Enaas Taleb is suing The Economist newspaper for using a picture of her to illustrate an article about Arab women being "fatter" than men. Taleb said that the image was used out of context without her permission, and violated her privacy. She also claimed it had been photoshopped. Taleb added that she faced "bullying comments" on social media.

32.title: Antarctica ice shelf crumbling faster than anticipated: NASA study
32.article_body: According to a NASA study, glaciers in Antarctica are shedding icebergs more rapidly than nature can replenish. Satellite analysis shows net loss of Antarctic ice is nearly as great as net amount of ice being lost due to thinning caused by melting ice shelves. "Antarctica holds 88% of the sea level potential of all the world's ice," lead author said.

33.title: PCB just wants to please the captain, player issues don't matter: Afridi
33.article_body: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Shahid Afridi said the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) just wants to please the captain and agree to his demands. "Issues faced by players don't matter...The formation of a players association will be very beneficial," added Afridi. Afridi stated that ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq had pushed for the formation of a players association but the PCB didn't agree to it.

34.title: Iranian who offered to pay $300,000 to kill ex-Trump adviser charged: US
34.article_body: The US has charged a member of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) with plotting to murder ex-President Donald Trump's former National Security Adviser, John Bolton. Shahram Poursafi offered $300,000 to individuals in US to carry out the killing, the Justice Department said. Poursafi was likely seeking revenge for 2020 US airstrike that killed IRGC commander Qassem Soleimani, it added.

35.title: Result of IAF Agniveer Recruitment 2022 phase 1 exam declared
35.article_body: The Indian Air Force has released the result of Agniveer Recruitment 2022 phase 1 exam. The candidates, who took the Air Force Agniveer Recruitment examination, can check and download their results online from the official website - https://agnipathvayu.cdac.in/. The candidates can access the IAF Agniveer Vayu Result 2022  online by logging in using their email id and password.

36.title: It's not true: Tiger Shroff on reports of dating Akanksha Sharma
36.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff has reacted to reports stating that he is dating Akanksha Sharma, who was Tiger's co-star in his music video 'Casanova'. Speaking about the reports, Tiger told ETimes, "It's not true." Akanksha also featured with Tiger in 'I am a Disco Dancer 2.0'. This comes after Tiger and actress Disha Patani reportedly parted ways.

37.title: I thought 'Here we go again, another Tendulkar': Lee on bowling to Sehwag
37.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee has said when he thinks of the words "cruel, swashbuckling and unpredictable", he thinks of ex-India opener Virender Sehwag. "You'd bowl that beautiful line and length thinking I've got him...[but] Sehwag would go bang...[he] looked a little bit like Sachin Tendulkar when he was batting. And I thought 'here we go again. Another Tendulkar'," recalled Lee.

38.title: Delhi makes face masks mandatory in public places, ₹500 fine for violators
38.article_body: Delhi government has made the wearing of face masks in all public places mandatory. A fine of ₹500 will be imposed on violators, as per the official order. Those travelling together in private four-wheeler vehicles will not be fined, the order states. Notably, Delhi on Wednesday reported 2,146 new COVID-19 cases and eight deaths, the highest in nearly six months.

39.title: Economic crisis triggers violent anti-govt protests in Sierra Leone
39.article_body: People in the West African country of Sierra Leone have been protesting against rising inflation, increasing prices of basic goods, fuel shortage and other economic hardships. At least two police officers and one civilian died as anti-government protests in the capital Freetown turned violent. According to NetBlocks, Sierra Leone had only 5% of internet connectivity nationwide during protests.

40.title: Fraudsters lure couple to invest money, cheat them of ₹3 lakh in Pune
40.article_body: Fraudsters lured a couple from Pune's Dehu Road to invest money in a fake scheme and allegedly cheated them of ₹3 lakh. The accused had promised the victims returns of about ₹1 lakh every month, police added. The accused had been in touch with the complainant over the phone since April 16, 2022, police further said.

41.title: CBI arrests TMC leader Anubrata Mondal from his house in cattle smuggling scam
41.article_body: CBI on Thursday arrested Trinamool Congress (TMC) Birbhum district president Anubrata Mondal from his house in connection with the cattle smuggling scam. He was taken for a medical examination following his arrest. A CBI team on Thursday morning arrived at Mondal's residence in Bolpur. This comes after he failed to appear for questioning twice in three days.

42.title: Have grown up watching Aamir, took his films as reference points: Naga
42.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya said he has grown up watching 'Laal Singh Chaddha' co-star Aamir Khan's films. "Even before I became an actor, I...took his films as reference points for me, for my craft, to develop myself," he added. Naga stated that it was a "huge boost of confidence" for him as Aamir liked what he has added to the film.

43.title: Will have a special place in my heart: Preity on 21 yrs of 'Dil...'
43.article_body: Preity Zinta took to Instagram after her film 'Dil Chahta Hai' completed 21 years of its release on Wednesday. "A film where there was no place for a hero...heroine, just relatable characters that we could reach out...touch and laugh out aloud with," she wrote. Preity added that the 2001 film will "always have a very special place" in her heart.

44.title: Stop lowering dignity of PM's post: Rahul on PM Modi's 'black magic' remark
44.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi reacted to PM Narendra Modi’s "black magic" remark. "PM doesn’t see inflation...unemployment? PM Ji, stop lowering the dignity of the PM's post and misleading the country by talking about superstitious things like 'black magic' to hide your black deeds," Rahul tweeted. PM Modi's remark came in reference to Opposition's protest in black dresses on August 5.

45.title: Nitish Kumar not asset but liability to politics: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari
45.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Wednesday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is not an asset but a liability to politics. "BJP has benefited from what happened in Bihar. BJP and PM Modi's image helped Nitish Kumar to form government in Bihar in 2020," Adhikari added. BJP will make a government on its own strength in Bihar, Adhikari stated.

46.title: MP tribal man killed after forest officers open fire, murder case filed
46.article_body: A 33-year-old tribal man was killed and three others were injured after forest officers allegedly opened fire at them when they were allegedly chopping wood illegally in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha, police said. "The officials confronted the people carrying wood...they abandoned their vehicles...started pelting stones," an officer said. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has ordered a judicial inquiry.

47.title: Amit Shah is backstage hero, has no desire for credit: Rajnath Singh
47.article_body: Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday said it will not be an exaggeration to say that Union Home Minister Amit Shah is a "backstage hero" who has no desire for credit. "He remains in the background and does so much work for the government as well as for the party and still gets time to study so much," Singh added.

48.title: Startups should focus on growth & profitability: Infosys Co-founder
48.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani said startups should not debate whether to chase growth or profitability, both should happen at the same time, in tandem with each other. Speaking at a startup summit hosted by Bengaluru-based firm xto10x, Nilekani advised startups to invest in its people and hire rightly. "I'm a strong believer in not spending...on customer acquisition," Nilekani added.

49.title: Only one among Karthik or Pant can play: Parthiv Patel on Asia Cup
49.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said one among Dinesh Karthik or Rishabh Pant can be part of the lineup during Asia Cup, if Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul are together included in the playing 11. Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth had earlier stated that he "doubts" whether Karthik will be picked in the lineup during Asia Cup.

50.title: Musk's lawyers seek to question Twitter team which counts bots: Reports
50.article_body: Elon Musk's legal team said Twitter must turn over names of employees who have been tasked to calculate what percentage of Twitter's users are bots and spam accounts, according to reports. Musk's lawyers reportedly asked for the names so that defence team can question them. Last month, Musk terminated $44 billion Twitter deal, saying the platform withheld information on bots.

51.title: India reports 16,299 new COVID-19 cases and 53 deaths
51.article_body: India has reported 16,299 new COVID-19 cases and 53 deaths in the last 24 hours, including four reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,25,076, while the daily positivity rate stood at 4.58%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,26,879.

52.title: 10,000 people forced to evacuate as wildfires rage in France
52.article_body: About 10,000 people were forced to evacuate as wildfires tore through Gironde region of southwestern France on Wednesday. The fires have burned about 6,200 hectares of land so far. At present, dozens of wildfires are ablaze across the country, including at least eight major ones. France has been struggling this summer with successive heatwaves and its worst drought on record.

53.title: WB CID raids Jharkhand MLA Irfan Ansari's house, seizes ₹5 lakh in cash
53.article_body: West Bengal CID conducted a raid at Jharkhand MLA Irfan Ansari's residence at Jamtara and seized ₹5 lakh in cash. They also seized the SUV that was earlier used to bring ₹75 lakh in cash from Kolkata. WB Police on July 31 arrested Ansari and two other Congress MLAs after seizing ₹49 lakh in cash from a car.

54.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava on ventilator, critical after heart attack: Reports
54.article_body: Comedian-actor Raju Srivastava is "critical and on ventilator" at Delhi's AIIMS, news agencies ANI and PTI said quoting hospital sources. Following a heart attack on Wednesday, the 58-year-old was admitted to the hospital where he underwent angioplasty. Srivastava suffered a heart attack while working out at a gym.

55.title: Gold prices fall after US Fed officials hint at interest rate hike
55.article_body: Gold prices fell on Thursday as the dollar and Treasury yields rebounded after US Federal Reserve officials hinted at interest rate hikes despite the inflation in the US showing signs of cooling down. Spot gold declined 0.2% to $1,788.07 per ounce after touching its highest since July 5 at $1,807.79 on Wednesday, while US gold futures fell 0.5% to $1,805.10.

56.title: SAIL Q1 net profit falls 79% to ₹804 crore due to higher expenses
56.article_body: The Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) on Wednesday reported a 79% fall in its consolidated net profit to ₹804.50 crore in the quarter ended June as against ₹3,897.36 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Higher expenses by the company led to the decline as it increased to ₹23,295.23 crore as against ₹15,604.07 crore a year ago.

57.title: CWG medallist long jumper Sreeshankar finishes 6th on Diamond League debut
57.article_body: Commonwealth Games silver medallist long jumper Murali Sreeshankar finished sixth with his best jump of 7.94m on his Diamond League debut in Monaco. Sreeshankar had won the medal in Birmingham CWG with his best effort of 8.08m. Maykel Masso of Cuba won the event with an 8.35m jump while Olympic champion Miltiadis Tentoglou of Greece finished second with 8.31m.

58.title: It's hard to digest: Harmanpreet Singh on 'bitter' 0-7 loss vs Aus
58.article_body: Harmanpreet Singh, who is the vice-captain of the Indian men's hockey team, said it is "hard to digest" the team's 0-7 loss against Australia in their gold medal match at CWG 2022. "The entire team is disappointed by how we played," added Harmanpreet. Ex-Indian men's hockey team captain Viren Rasquinha earlier tweeted that the loss had left him "really heartbroken".

59.title: Don't beat around the bush: Priyanka on PM Modi's 'black magic' remark
59.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra reacted to PM Narendra Modi's "black magic" remark. "PM Narendra Modi Ji, don't beat around the bush, tell people why you looted them by increasing prices?" Priyanka tweeted. Referring to Opposition's protest in black dresses on August 5, PM Modi said those who believe in black magic will never be able to earn people's trust.

60.title: Sensex jumps 585 points, Nifty above 17,700 in opening trade
60.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Thursday with Sensex and Nifty surging 585.21 points and 161.40 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 59,402.50 points and Nifty at 17,696.20. Eicher Motors, Tech Mahindra, Wipro, ICICI Bank and Infosys were among the major Nifty gainers, while Hindalco Industries, Tata Consumer Products, Divis Labs, Apollo Hospitals and SBI Life Insurance slipped.

61.title: There was a 'lot' of pressure: CWG 2022 gold medallist Lakshya Sen
61.article_body: India's 20-year-old shuttler Lakshya Sen, who helped the nation win its 20th gold medal at CWG 2022, said, "There was a lot of pressure this time because of past results." "I knew it wasn't going to be easy...[but believed] that I could go all the way," added Lakshya. Lakshya took off his jersey in celebration after winning the gold medal.

62.title: Anyone can announce free fuel, it will prevent India from becoming self-reliant: PM Modi
62.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated the second generation ethanol plant in Haryana, saying that anyone can announce to give free petrol and diesel but such steps take away our children's rights and prevent the country from becoming self-reliant. He also added, "Selfish announcements of freebies will increase burden on honest taxpayers and prevent investment in new technologies."

63.title: 'Who cares?': Nancy Pelosi laughs off Chinese sanctions over Taiwan visit
63.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Wednesday laughed off China's move to impose sanctions on her and her immediate family members over the Taiwan visit, saying, "Who cares?" She added, "That's incidental to me, of no relevance whatsoever." Pelosi also defended her trip and said, "We went there to praise Taiwan...to show our friendship, to say China cannot isolate Taiwan."

64.title: Pant seemingly responds to Urvashi's interview about 'RP', says 'Leave me alone, sister'
64.article_body: Cricketer Rishabh Pant seemingly responded to actress Urvashi Rautela's recent viral interview wherein she talked about how a person named 'RP' wanted to meet her in Delhi and how she missed his calls 16-17 times. "It’s funny how people lie in interviews just for...meagre popularity and for hitting headlines," he wrote. "Mera picha chorho...behen (Leave me alone, sister)," he added.

65.title: Nitish Kumar told Amit Shah 'not to worry' a day before breaking alliance: Sushil Modi
65.article_body: Senior BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Wednesday said Union Home Minister Amit Shah had called Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar a day before he parted ways with the party and joined hands with the RJD-led Grand Alliance. Modi said Kumar had assured Shah that he had "nothing to worry about".

66.title: Absconding Kerala Congress councillor arrested in sexual assault case
66.article_body: A Congress councillor from Kerala's Kannur, who is accused in a sexual assault case and was allegedly absconding for the last two weeks, was arrested from Karnataka's Bengaluru on Tuesday night, police said. This comes after a female employee of a women's cooperative bank, reportedly controlled by the Congress party, had filed a case against him for alleged sexual assault.

67.title: I will give her a hug: Naga Chaitanya on if he meets ex-wife Samantha
67.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, during an interview, revealed what his reaction would be if he met his ex-wife Samantha Ruth Prabhu. "I'll say hi...give her a hug," he said. This comes after Samantha, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', had said, "If you put us both in a room, you've to hide sharp objects? Yeah. As of now, yes."

68.title: Harika shares pic after winning bronze at Chess Olympiad while being 9 months pregnant
68.article_body: Grandmaster Harika Dronavalli shared a picture of herself after winning bronze at Chess Olympiad while being nine months pregnant. "I always dreamt about being on podium...and finally made it," she wrote. She added, "It's more emotional because I made it at 9 months of pregnancy." She wrote, "No baby showers...no parties...no celebrations...I decided everything will be...after winning the medal."

69.title: I've not felt anything like that: Gulshan on insider vs outsider debate
69.article_body: Actor Gulshan Devaiah opened up about the insider versus outsider debate and said that he has not felt anything like that in the film industry. "When I started working here, I felt that this place, this town has given me a space," he added. Gulshan further said that he might be in a small space but that is his space.

70.title: Real Madrid beat Eintracht 2-0 for record-equalling 5th UEFA Super Cup win
70.article_body: Real Madrid defeated Eintracht Frankfurt 2-0 to win the UEFA Super Cup for a record-equalling fifth time. AC Milan and Barcelona also have five Super Cup wins. In the match, David Alaba opened the scoring for Madrid and Karim Benzema doubled the lead in the 65th minute. Notably, Benzema has now become the second-highest goalscorer for Real Madrid.

71.title: BJP should have made Sushil Modi Bihar CM in 2020: Nitish Kumar
71.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said that BJP should have made Sushil Kumar Modi the CM of the state after the 2020 Assembly elections. "Had he been appointed to the post, things would not have reached this stage," he added. This comes after Nitish ended the alliance with BJP in Bihar. Notably, Modi has previously served as Bihar's Deputy CM.

72.title: Unfortunate that only few people aware of constitutional rights: Outgoing CJI
72.article_body: Outgoing CJI NV Ramana on Wednesday said that the public must know their constitutional rights and duties. "It's unfortunate that we are now celebrating 75 years of independence but still only a few selected people in the urban areas or the legal professional are aware of the constitutional rights and duties and the constitutional principles," Ramana added.

73.title: I'm a drama queen, Suhana is the softest, Shanaya is sincere: Ananya
73.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday opened up about her relationship with Suhana Khan and Shanaya Kapoor and said that they are like sisters. "The three of us are similar but we all have something very unique in each of us," she said. Ananya added, "I'm a full-on drama queen. I'm very dramatic...Suhana is the softest...most loving. Shanaya is extremely hard-working and sincere."

74.title: 3 soldiers martyred in terrorist attack at Army camp in J&K; 2 terrorists killed
74.article_body: Three Army personnel were martyred and two terrorists were killed when the terrorists attempted to infiltrate the Army camp in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri, an Army official said on Thursday. According to some reports, two more soldiers were injured in the terrorist attack. The attack comes ahead of the Independence Day celebrations.

75.title: I hate it: Suniel Shetty on calls to boycott 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
75.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said he "hates" the calls to boycott 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan', which star Aamir Khan and Akshay Kumar respectively. "It's unfair...Let's not destroy an industry that has its own legacy of good people and people who probably at some stage make mistakes," added Suniel. "There are a lot of people feeding off us," he stated.

76.title: Engineer arrested by CBI for demanding bribe of ₹2.5 lakh in Maharashtra
76.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has arrested an engineer of Utility Powertech Ltd in Maharashtra's Solapur for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹2.5 lakh and accepting an initial amount of ₹1 lakh from a contractor. "The accused has been...looking after the safety and accounts-related issues in the absence of a regular accountant," a release from CBI stated.

77.title: 2 in cargo theft racket held with home appliances worth ₹23 lakh in Pune
77.article_body: Pune's Kondhwa Police busted an inter-state cargo theft racket and arrested two persons with home appliances worth ₹23 lakh. This comes after various electronic home appliances loaded on a cargo container which was parked in Gokul Nagar were stolen. "Nagpur and Hyderabad Police are looking for (the accused) in almost 20 theft cases registered there," Kondhwa Police said.

78.title: Set up a body led by PM Modi, Pope to end wars around the world: Mexico President
78.article_body: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has said he'll submit a proposal to UN for setting up a commission, comprising PM Narendra Modi, Pope Francis and UN chief. Obrador added the aim of the commission would be to present a proposal to "stop wars around the world and reach an agreement to seek a truce for at least five years".

79.title: 2 brothers held for killing ragpicker over 'bidi' in Delhi's Daryaganj
79.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two brothers, aged 21 and 19, for allegedly stabbing a ragpicker to death in a fight over 'bidi' in the Daryaganj area. The accused, who are also ragpickers, had asked the victim for a smoke, police said. The victim refused them 'bidi' and allegedly cussed at them which led to a quarrel, police further said.

80.title: Satish Shah shares pic claiming Indian flag in it is from 1942, Twitter users correct him
80.article_body: Actor Satish Shah shared a picture with an Indian flag, tweeting, "The very same TIRANGA DHWAJ my mother had got during Quit India Movement 1942." "This version of the flag was adopted in 1947...in 1942 it was the INC flag with...spinning wheel," a user wrote. "A little bit of research...would've saved you the embarrassment of being proven wrong," another commented.

81.title: 20-year-old Will Smeed smashes The Hundred's first hundred
81.article_body: Birmingham Phoenix opener Will Smeed has become the first cricketer to smash a hundred in The Hundred. The 20-year-old slammed an unbeaten 101 off 50 deliveries against Southern Brave on Wednesday. His knock included six sixes and eight fours. The previous highest score in The Hundred was 92*(40), registered by Birmingham Phoenix's Liam Livingstone against Northern Superchargers last year.

82.title: Disney overtakes Netflix as total subscribers reach 221 million
82.article_body: Walt Disney Co surpassed Netflix Inc with a total of 221 million streaming subscribers at the end of the most recent quarter. Netflix said it had 220.7 million streaming subscribers. "We continue to transform entertainment as we near our second century, with compelling new storytelling across our many platforms," said  Bob Chapek, Chief Executive Officer, The Walt Disney Company.

83.title: North Korea declares victory over COVID-19
83.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un declared victory in the battle against COVID-19 on Thursday, with the leader's sister revealing he had suffered from fever. Kim ordered a lifting of maximum anti-epidemic measures imposed in May. "North Korea must maintain a steel-strong anti-epidemic barrier and intensifying the anti-epidemic work until the end of the global health crisis," he said.

84.title: Elon Musk teases 'X.com' as a potential social media site of his own
84.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user who asked, "Have you thought about creating your own social platform? If Twitter deal doesn't come through," Elon Musk replied with a website domain - X.com. The comment came after he sold 7.92 million Tesla shares worth $6.9 billion. Musk said he sold the shares to avoid emergency sale if Twitter forces deal to close.

85.title: Life is not 'Bigg Boss': Raqesh on break-up with Shamita
85.article_body: Shamita Shetty and Raqesh Bapat opened up about why they decided to break up. While Shamita said she wanted to focus more on herself than 'ShaRa,' Raqesh said if they were in the Bigg Boss house, people would have seen why things didn't work out between them. "Life is not just the Bigg Boss house," he concluded.

86.title: Man poses as ED official, demands ₹3 cr from ex-MLA; held in Punjab
86.article_body: A man has been arrested in Punjab for allegedly demanding ₹3 crore from former MLA Navtej Singh Cheema by impersonating as an official of the Enforcement Directorate (ED). In his complaint, Cheema had alleged that the man threatened to implicate him in a money laundering case if the money was not paid. The accused has been identified as Aman Sharma.

87.title: Easebuzz gets RBI in-principle approval for aggregating payments
87.article_body: Payments platform Easebuzz has received in-principle approval from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) for Payment Aggregator (PA) authorisation. In March 2020, the RBI issued guidelines to regulate the Payment Aggregators (PAs) and Payment Gateways (PGs) to facilitate payments in the online space. Easebuzz joins Razorpay, Stripe, Pine Labs and MSwipe that have received in-principle approval.

88.title: US Defense Secretary pledges military support to Baltics
88.article_body: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin on Wednesday said the US wants to hold more military exercises with Latvia and other Baltic nations. Austin, who is currently on a visit to Riga, said the US may even bring additional American troops to bolster the region against any Russian threat. Austin's visit comes as Russia's invasion of Ukraine enters its sixth month.

89.title: They want more sponsorship: Gavaskar on demand to allow Indian players in foreign leagues
89.article_body: Talking about foreign ex-cricketers demanding Indian players' presence in foreign leagues, Sunil Gavaskar said, "They want their leagues to have more sponsorship." He added, "They're concerned about their cricket." He stated, "When Indian cricket looks to protect its cricket by ensuring...players stay fresh...& thus restrict...them from playing overseas...that's not acceptable to...'old powers'."

90.title: Delhi airport installing IoT devices on its vehicles
90.article_body: The Delhi International Airport Limited is installing internet-of-things (IoT) devices on vehicles it operates at Indira Gandhi International Airport to enhance safety and save fuel, according to a statement on Wednesday. The IoT devices can also track location of vehicles and schedule maintenance, it noted. The devices will help in saving 23% fuel in utility vehicles and airside operations.

91.title: Infighting among pro-government forces in Yemen kill 35 troops
91.article_body: Clashes among pro-government Yemeni forces killed 35 troops in the last 24 hours in southern Shabwa province, officials said. Artillery fighting took place near an airport in Ataq city on Tuesday and five civilians were also killed. The fighting comes after weeks of tension within the Saudi-led pro-government forces, which have been fighting the Iran-backed Houthi rebels since 2015.

92.title: ASI suspended, 2 policemen shunted out for assaulting Raj school owner
92.article_body: An Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) has been suspended and two other policemen have been shunted to police lines for allegedly assaulting the owner of a private school in Bikaner, Rajasthan. Officials said that ASI of Gangashahar Police Station Bhawani Dan and two constables assaulted the school owner for not issuing transfer certificate to a student.

93.title: 'Haqeeqat' is the most patriotic war film to be made: Shekhar Kapur
93.article_body: Ahead of the 76th Independence Day, director Shekhar Kapur remembered Chetan Anand's 'Haqeeqat'. The filmmaker said the 1964 release is "the most realistic and patriotic war film to be made in India". He said the film will move the audience to tears and fill them with pride for the Indian Armed Forces. 'Haqeeqat' was based on the 1962 Sino-Indian war.

94.title: COVID-19 deaths fell by 9% worldwide in last week: WHO
94.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Wednesday said the number of COVID-19 deaths fell by 9% in the last week globally, while rate of fresh cases remained relatively stable. The UN agency said over 14,000 COVID-19 deaths were reported last week and around 7 million new infections were detected. The WHO cautioned the omicron sub-variant BA.5 remains dominant globally.

95.title: Zomato lowers Blinkit investment guidance to $320 million
95.article_body: Food delivery platform and restaurant aggregator Zomato has lowered the investment guidance in quick commerce company Blinkit from $400 million to $320 million for getting the business to breakeven, said Zomato CFO Akshant Goyal. Zomato is targeting adjusted EBITDA breakeven for its overall business by Q4 of FY 2023 or Q2 of FY 2024. Zomato acquired Blinkit in June 2022.

96.title: U'khand CM takes 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign near Indo-China border
96.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami took the Centre's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign to the tribal villages in the state's Chamoli district on the India-China border. Army jawans and residents of the villages participated in the campaign by holding national flags and chanted 'Bharat Mata ki Jai'. Dhami called 'Har Ghar Tiranga' a campaign of each and every individual.

97.title: 17% rise in crimes against women in Delhi; average of 6 rape cases daily
97.article_body: Delhi recorded a 17% increase in crimes against women in the first six-and-a-half months of 2022 compared to the same period last year, according to police data. In this period, the city registered 1,100 rape cases, averaging six rape cases daily. Cases of assault on women rose by almost 19% and cruelty by husbands and in-laws increased by 29%.

98.title: 9 Indian fishermen arrested for fishing in Sri Lankan waters
98.article_body: Nine Indian fishermen from Tamil Nadu were arrested for allegedly trespassing and fishing in Sri Lankan waters. The fishermen were from Nagapattinam and are being taken to Trincomalee port, Rameswaram Police said. Sri Lankan Navy had rescued six Indian fishermen who were left stranded due to a mechanical glitch in their boat, earlier this month.

99.title: Donald Trump declines to testify in probe into Trump Organization
99.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump declined to testify in a civil probe into his family's business practices at the New York Attorney General's office on Wednesday. Real estate company The Trump Organization is charged with overstating the values of its assets to obtain favourable loans. "I declined to answer...under the rights and privileges...afforded to every citizen," Trump said.

100.title: Govt didn't instruct denial of ration to people not buying national flag: PIB
100.article_body: Press Information Bureau (PIB) on Tuesday said posts claiming that the Centre instructed denial of ration to people who weren't buying the national flag are false. The clarification came after a video purportedly showing some people alleging that they were forced to buy a national flag to get ration went viral. PIB said the "errant" ration shop has been suspended.

101.title: Nitish's aides approached Bihar BJP over his wish to become VP: Sushil Modi
101.article_body: BJP MP and former Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi has claimed that some of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's aides had approached Bihar BJP leadership over Kumar's wish to become India's Vice President. "This shows Nitish did nurse national ambition," Modi said. "We're stunned at what he did and the manner in which he broke up with us," Modi added.

102.title: Respect needs to be earned: Charu Asopa on Rajeev Sen
102.article_body: Actress Charu Asopa has said that her husband Rajeev Sen's lies about her have caused her immense hurt. Talking about her relationship with Rajeev, Charu said that while she will always pray for his happiness, "respect is something that needs to be earned". She added that nothing can be sorted out between the two.

103.title: China 'firmly opposes' new US law on processor chips
103.article_body: China on Wednesday said it "firmly opposes" a recently signed US law which encourages domestic producers of processor chips to reduce dependence on Asian suppliers. This week, US President Joe Biden promised $52 billion in grants to investors in chip factories in the US. China said this will "disrupt international trade and distort global semiconductor supply chains".

104.title: If a filmmaker makes film about temple, it's termed casteist: Karthi
104.article_body: Tamil actor Karthi will next be seen in M Muthaiya's 'Viruman'. The filmmaker was earlier criticised for allegedly glorifying casteism. When asked about it, Karthi said, "If a filmmaker wants to make a movie about a temple, it is termed casteist. Then no one can make films about any culture." He added, "One can only make films about his culture."

105.title: 'Darlings' to be adapted in Tamil & Telugu
105.article_body: Alia Bhatt's maiden production 'Darlings' is set to be remade in Telugu and Tamil. Gaurav Verma, producer and COO, Red Chillies Entertainment, confirmed the development. He said the story will remain the same but it will be adapted as per the local sensibilities. "Of course, there will be language barriers, but we will make sure it's done correctly," he said.

106.title: 9 Russian warplanes destroyed in Crimea: Ukraine
106.article_body: Ukraine’s air force on Wednesday said nine Russian warplanes were damaged in a string of explosions it carried out in Crimea on Tuesday. Russia has denied any attack in Crimea and rubbished reports of any damage to its aircraft. Russia has used the air base in Crimea to attack southern Ukraine in the ongoing war.

107.title: Ripple Labs 'interested' in bankrupt crypto lender Celsius' assets
107.article_body: Blockchain payments firm Ripple Labs is "interested" in potentially purchasing assets of bankrupt Celsius network, a company spokesperson said. Declining to say if Ripple was interested in acquiring Celsius, the spokesperson said, "We're interested in learning...whether [Celsius' assets] could be relevant to our business." "Ripple has continued to grow exponentially," the spokesperson added.

108.title: UP govt to provide free bus travel for women aged above 60: CM
108.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said that the state government is considering to provide free bus travel for women aged above 60 on state-run buses. He made the statement at an event organised to flag off 150 new diesel buses. "We are providing free bus service for women from [Wednesday-Friday] on the occasion of Raksha Bandhan," he said.

109.title: Singer Arjun Kanungo gets married to Carla Dennis, pics surface
109.article_body: Singer Arjun Kanungo tied the knot with his girlfriend, South African model Carla Dennis in Mumbai on Wednesday. They got married in an intimate ceremony in the presence of their family members and close friends. While Arjun can be seen dressed in an ivory sherwani, Carla wore a red bridal lehenga. The couple reportedly dated for over seven years.

110.title: 2 Pakistani boxers go missing in UK after Commonwealth Games 2022
110.article_body: Two Pakistani boxers have gone missing in Birmingham after the conclusion of the Commonwealth Games, Pakistan Boxing Federation (PBF) said. As per PBF's secretary Nasir Tang, Suleman Baloch and Nazeerullah disappeared a couple of hours before the team’s departure for Islamabad. The Pakistan Olympic Association has formed a four-member committee to investigate the matter of the missing boxers.

111.title: Nitish didn't want to become Bihar CM in 2020, BJP forced him: JD(U) chief
111.article_body: Janata Dal (United) National President Lalan Singh alias RR Singh on Wednesday claimed that Nitish Kumar didn't want to become Bihar CM in 2020. However, BJP compelled Kumar to take the post, Singh said. Ex-Union Minister RCP Singh, who said JD(U) is a sinking ship and resigned from the party on Saturday, came to JD(U) as BJP's agent, Singh added.

112.title: Noodle-like object spotted on Mars identified by NASA
112.article_body: NASA has identified the noodle-like object that was spotted by Perseverance rover last month. The material is a piece of tangled Dacron netting from the entry, descent and landing (EDL) gear that landed the rover on Martian surface, as per NASA. "This particular piece of netting appears to have undergone significant unraveling/shredding, suggesting...it was subjected to strong forces," NASA said.

113.title: Water park accused of racism for cancelling Black teen's party in US
113.article_body: A water park outside US' Kansas City has been accused of racism after reportedly cancelling a Black teenager's birthday party. Chris Evans, who organised the party for his 17-year-old son, said he had signed a $1,900 contract to reserve the facility but the guests were denied entry. A park official reportedly told Evans that she was "uncomfortable" with the party.

114.title: Sri Lanka extends overseas travel ban on ex-PM Rajapaksa till Sept 5
114.article_body: Sri Lanka's Supreme Court on Wednesday extended the overseas travel ban on former Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa and former Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa till September 5. Mahinda and Basil's brother Gotabaya Rajapaksa, the ex-Sri Lankan President, had fled the country in July amid violent protests. The Rajapaksa family is blamed for the economic crisis in the country.

115.title: US man killed in sand dune collapse while filming sunrise at beach
115.article_body: A 35-year-old man was killed after a sand dune on a beach collapsed on him in US' Florida, authorities said on Monday. The man was believed to have been resting while filming a video of the sunrise. "It was an unusual scene with his feet sticking out of the sand...we had to dig down and find the body," police said.

116.title: Reliance Industries unveils MI Emirates and MI Cape Town franchises
116.article_body: MI owners Reliance Industries today unveiled the name and brand identity of their two new T20 franchises. Their UAE franchise has been named 'MI Emirates', while 'MI Cape Town' is the name of their South African franchise. "'MI Emirates' or phonetically 'MY Emirates' and 'MY Cape Town' respectively, are dedicated to fans across both...Emirates and Cape Town," Reliance said.

117.title: Immigration to Israel from Ukraine and Russia rises amid war
117.article_body: Immigration from Russia and Ukraine to Israel has increased since the outbreak of war in February, official data showed on Wednesday. Over 31,000 people have emigrated to Israel since the start of the invasion. This is 318% higher than a similar period in 2019 when a total of 9,774 new immigrants arrived from the two countries.

118.title: JP Nadda appoints Sunil Bansal as General Secretary of BJP
118.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Wednesday appointed Sunil Bansal as the national General Secretary of the party. Bansal, who was previously the BJP General Secretary in Uttar Pradesh, has also been appointed as the state in-charge of BJP for three opposition-ruled states — West Bengal, Odisha and Telangana. Bansal successfully handled the 2017 and 2022 Assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh.

119.title: Nitish Kumar 'guide' for all who want to change party in 6 months: Assam CM
119.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma called Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar a "margdarshak (guide)" for politicians who wish to switch parties every six months. He asked, "How can you guarantee that Nitish Kumar will not leave this coalition after 6-8 months?" Sarma added, "We've also changed political party but we've not changed like him."

120.title: Our car, trees, house have suddenly become illegal: Tyagi's wife
120.article_body: Self-proclaimed BJP leader Shrikant Tyagi's wife, Anu, on Wednesday said that her husband's actions were wrong and he should have apologised. "The topic was that he insulted a woman. It should have been handled like that. But everything is now being dragged. Our car, trees [and] house...[have] suddenly become illegal," Anu added. Earlier, Tyagi's residence was demolished in Noida.

121.title: Sedition charges filed against Imran Khan's aide over comments about army
121.article_body: Sedition charges were filed against a close aide to Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan after being accused of inciting mutiny in the military during a TV appearance. Shahbaz Gill had accused the military top brass of trying to influence the junior ranks against Khan's party. The comments were aired on ARY TV, which was taken off air this week.

122.title: Thief prays to deity before robbing valuables from temple in MP, video goes viral
122.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a thief praying to the deity before robbing valuables from a temple in Madhya Pradesh. In the video, the thief, who's shirtless, can be seen praying to the deity with his hands folded. After a while, he can be seen stealing the donation box. The act was captured by a CCTV camera.

123.title: Men beaten up by Gurugram club bouncers for opposing alleged molestation of friend
123.article_body: A manager of a multinational company filed a police complaint alleging that bouncers of a Gurugram club beat him and his friends after they confronted one of them for allegedly touching their female friend inappropriately. Police said an FIR has been registered against the bouncers. The bouncers allegedly took away a watch and around ₹12,000 from one of the men.

124.title: Former Twitter employee convicted of spying for Saudi Arabia
124.article_body: Ahmad AbouAmmo, Twitter's ex-media partnership manager for the Middle East region, has been convicted in the US for failing to register as an agent for Saudi Arabia. A jury found him guilty on six counts, including conspiracy to commit wire fraud and money laundering. The case marked the first time Saudi Arabia has been accused of spying in the US.

125.title: J&K LG Manoj Sinha launches key education initiatives
125.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir, Manoj Sinha, launched several key education initiatives in the Union Territory. Sinha inaugurated 119 civil projects, including 84 school buildings and also laid the foundation stones of two residential schools for tribal students. He said that the new beginning will redefine the teaching-learning process and bring changes in the functioning of schools.

126.title: 3 LeT terrorists killed in an encounter in J&K's Budgam
126.article_body: Three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists were killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam, the police said. The Additional Director General of Police (ADGP) Kashmir identified one of the terrorists as Lateef Rather, who killed Rahul Bhat and Amreen Bhat, and was involved in several targeted killings. He further added that arms and ammunition, among other incriminating materials were recovered.

127.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
127.article_body: As per IMD's latest bulletin, rainfall with isolated heavy falls and thunderstorm is very likely over Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh till August 14. It's very likely in parts of Maharashtra till August 12 and in Goa till August 13. Heavy rainfall is also predicted over Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Mizoram and Tripura over the next few days.

128.title: Website creator Wix.com to cut costs, lay-off staff amid slow global growth
128.article_body: Wix.com on Wednesday said it aims to cut costs by $150 million/year to compensate for a global economic slowdown and a stronger dollar. Under a three-year plan, Wix said it would take comprehensive cost-cutting measures, including job cuts, aimed at raising free cash flow. About 20% of the annualised savings are expected to be realised already in 2022, Wix added.

129.title: Want a commission on global truce led by PM Modi, Pope: Mexican Prez
129.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said he'll submit a written proposal to the UN to create a commission on global truce led by PM Narendra Modi, Pope Francis and UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres. The aim of the commission would be to present proposals to stop wars globally and reach an agreement to seek truce for at least five years.

130.title: Vlogger encourages student to try ganja on video chat, held in Kerala
130.article_body: A vlogger from Kerala's Mattancherry was arrested on Tuesday after he encouraged a school girl to try ganja during a video chat, which had surfaced on social media. An excise team, led by Mattancherry Range Inspector V S Pradeep, conducted a search at Francis Nevin Augustine's house and recovered two grams of ganja. The contraband was concealed in Augustine's garments.

131.title: Rubina Dilaik confirms being part of Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10
131.article_body: TV actress Rubina Dilaik will be participating in Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10. Talking about the show, she said that while she has danced on screen before, performing in front of the judges and "the queen of dance, Madhuri Dixit" will be a challenge. She said she is looking forward to learning new dance styles and improving her dance skills.

132.title: PM Modi inaugurates ₹900-crore 2G ethanol plant in Panipat
132.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated a 2G (second generation) ethanol plant in Panipat, Haryana. "In our country...biofuel is significant for protecting nature," the PM said. The plant, built at an estimated cost of ₹900 crore by Indian Oil Corporation Limited, aims to utilise about two lakh tonnes of rice straw to generate around three crore litres of ethanol annually.

133.title: Physically challenged man forced to lick feet of another person in Odisha, video surfaces
133.article_body: A video from Mayurbhanj, Odisha shows a physically challenged man being tortured by two people. The clip shows one of the men with a stick forcing the victim to lick the feet of another person. Police said the incident took place at a drug de-addiction centre last year and the two men have been arrested.

134.title: Sri Lankan minister introduces bill to reduce presidential powers
134.article_body: Sri Lankan Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe on Wednesday submitted to the Parliament a constitutional amendment bill that would reduce the powers of the President. The bill, which will undergo debate, must be approved by two-thirds of Sri Lanka's Parliament to become law. A reduction in the President's power was a key demand of protesters.

135.title: Mother slept during 'Tumbbad' premiere, asked me to make good films: Sohum Shah
135.article_body: Actor and producer Sohum Shah revealed his mother fell asleep during the premiere of his film 'Tumbbad' in Venice. "My nephew woke her up," Sohum said. "After coming out, she said, 'Ye kaisi filmein banata hai, kitni darawani film hai, koi dhang ki film banaya kar (why do you make such films, it's scary. Make some good films)'," Sohum said.

136.title: China calls US 'main instigator' of crisis in Ukraine
136.article_body: The Chinese Ambassador to Russia, Zhang Hanhui, has called the US the "main instigator" of the crisis in Ukraine. "Their ultimate goal is to exhaust and crush Russia with a protracted war and the cudgel of sanctions," he added. "Non-intervention in internal affairs is the most fundamental principle of maintaining peace and stability in our world," he further said.

137.title: OYO acquires Danish holiday home operator Bornholmske Feriehuse
137.article_body: Travel and hospitality unicorn OYO has acquired Denmark-based holiday home operator Bornholmske Feriehuse for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition was done by the company's subsidiary, DanCenter, through the 'Invest in Denmark' initiative by the Danish government. Founded by Rasmus Lund and Jacob Lund, Bornholmske Feriehuse provides end-to-end solutions to homeowners and has 737 holiday homes.

138.title: Retention platform CleverTap raises $105 mn in Series D round
138.article_body: Customer engagement and user retention platform CleverTap has raised $105 million in a Series D funding round led by Canada's pension fund CDPQ. IIFL's Asset Management Company (AMC) Tech Fund, along with existing investors Tiger Global and Sequoia India participated in the round. The company valuation was doubled and is now at $775 million from $385 million in October 2019.

139.title: Eyewear platform Lenskart raises $12.57 mn from Manyavar owners
139.article_body: As part of its ongoing funding round, eyewear platform Lenskart has raised $12.57 million from Ravi Modi Family Trust. The fundraise is part of a larger funding round, which has seen participation from Temasek, Avendus Future Leaders Fund, Epiq Capital, among others. The Ravi Modi Family Trust owns brands such as Manyavar, Mohey, and Manthan.

140.title: Agniveer recruitment for female candidates in Bengaluru from Nov 1
140.article_body: The Agniveer recruitment rally for military police under general duty category for female candidates will be held in Bengaluru from November 1 to 3. Candidates from Karnataka, Kerala and the Union Territory of Lakshadweep and Mahe can take part in it. Online registration for the recruitment rally can be done on http://www.joinindianarmy.nic.in from August 10 to September 7.

141.title: 1,000-year-old idols recovered from hideout in Tamil Nadu
141.article_body: Five idols, reportedly around 1,000 years old, were among eight idols recovered from a hideout in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur district, police said on Wednesday. The 1,000-year-old idols are of Goddess Bogasakti Amman, Lord Buddha, poet Andal and Lord Vishnu. They are worth crores of rupees in the international market, police said, adding a 100-year-old Nataraja idol was also seized.

142.title: Ex-Manchester United star Giggs' alleged abusive text messages to ex-girlfriend surface
142.article_body: The alleged abusive text messages Ryan Giggs sent to his ex-girlfriend Kate Greville, who has accused him of controlling and physically assaulting her, were shown to the court during his trial. "Please unblock me. All this blocking malarkey is poo. Promise, no more naked piccies [pictures]," a message read. "Only an evil, horrible c**t does that," another message read.

143.title: US inflation falls to 8.5%, drops for the first time since April
143.article_body: Amid the falling gas prices, the US' consumer price index rose 8.5% year-over-year in July, according to US' government data. It is down from a 9.1% annual rise in June, which was a 40-year high. Further, it has fallen for the first time since April. On a monthly basis, consumer prices were unchanged, compared to a 1.3% rise in June.

144.title: Forced to buy ₹20 national flag to get ration: Haryana locals
144.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi has shared a video showing ration card holders claiming that they're being forced to buy a national flag for ₹20 to get ration. The video is purportedly from Haryana's Karnal. The video showed a man, reportedly a state-run depot's staffer, saying, "We've been told not to give ration to anyone who refuses to buy the flag."

145.title: Corbevax approved as precaution dose for adults vaccinated with Covaxin, Covishield
145.article_body: Government approved Corbevax COVID-19 vaccine as a precaution dose for those above 18 years. It'll be available as precaution dose after completion of 6 months or 26 weeks from date of administration of second dose of either Covaxin or Covishield. "This enables use of Corbevax as a heterologous COVID-19 vaccine for precaution dose administration in this age group," said government.

146.title: Nitish dumped BJP after his VP ambition was refused: Sushil Modi
146.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Wednesday alleged Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar dumped the NDA as his ambition of becoming the country's Vice President could not be accommodated by the BJP. Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP in Bihar on Tuesday, joining hands with seven parties to form a 'Mahagathbandhan'. Nitish Kumar's JD(U) refuted Sushil's comments.

147.title: Crimes against humanity being committed in Myanmar: UN probe
147.article_body: Crimes against humanity continue to be systematically committed in Myanmar, with ongoing conflicts severely impacting women and children, according to a UN probe. Children in Myanmar have been tortured, conscripted and arbitrarily detained, it said. Myanmar plunged into a crisis after the removal of a civilian government by the military in February last year.

148.title: BJP wanted to topple J'khand govt, their own collapsed in Bihar: Baghel
148.article_body: Reacting to the end of the JDU-BJP alliance, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel claimed that while BJP wanted to topple the Jharkhand government, it couldn't save its own alliance in Bihar. NDA's allies are leaving, first, it was Akali Dal, then Shiv Sena and now JDU, he added. It's an indication that people have become disillusioned with Centre, he further said.

149.title: Use public transport: Police to Bengaluru flower show visitors
149.article_body: Bengaluru traffic police has urged visitors to the Independence Day Flower Show at Lalbagh Botanical Garden to use public transport. Police said the area was facing traffic congestion. Deputy Commissioner of Police (east Bengaluru), Kala Krishnaswamy, listed the metro station in Lal Bagh, the bus stand at Lal Bagh main gate, Shantinagar bus stand and Siddapura bus stand as options.

150.title: Nandita Das is the most hardworking director: Kapil Sharma
150.article_body: Comedian-turned-actor Kapil Sharma on Wednesday penned an appreciation post for director Nandita Das. Sharing a couple of photos on Instagram, Kapil wrote, "Me with my most hardworking, most talented, actor, writer, and pagal director." Kapil will be seen playing a food delivery partner in Nandita Das' untitled directorial. It will also star Shahana Goswami.

151.title: Some call dowry a 'gift' or 'sankalp', I call it 'extortion': Akshay Kumar
151.article_body: Akshay Kumar, who portrays the role of a brother struggling to get his four sisters married in his upcoming film 'Raksha Bandhan', said the film throws light on dowry practices in India. "Dowry is very much there in India...Some call it...'gift', 'sankalp'. It has different names. Some demand...to have the wedding on...large scale. I would call it extortion," Akshay said.

152.title: Police bust drug manufacturing unit in Hyderabad, 2 arrested
152.article_body: A drug manufacturing unit was raided in Hyderabad and large quantities of psychotropic substances were seized and two people who were involved in preparing and supplying narcotic substances were arrested, the police said. Police seized 53 grams of synthetic drugs and 3.6 kilograms of ephedrine, among other materials. One of the accused worked as a senior chemist.

153.title: China withdraws promise not to send troops to Taiwan if it takes control
153.article_body: China has withdrawn a promise not to send troops or administrators to Taiwan if it takes control of the island, an official document showed. The move signals a decision by President Xi Jinping to grant less autonomy than previously offered, Reuters said. Previously, China had proposed that Taiwan could return to its rule under a "one country, two systems" model.

154.title: CBI makes first arrests in Bengal SSC scam case as 2 top officials nabbed
154.article_body: CBI has made its first arrests in connection with the West Bengal school recruitment scam case. Those who were arrested are identified as Shanti Prasad Sinha, convenor of the special advisory committee formed for the appointments, and ex-secretary of the state School Service Commission Ashok Saha. Former minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide were arrested in this case in July.

155.title: Vrindavan widows send 501 handmade rakhis to PM Modi on Raksha Bandhan
155.article_body: Widows of UP's Vrindavan have sent 501 'rakhis' and 75 national flags to PM Narendra Modi on Raksha Bandhan. These rakhis will be delivered to the PM's office by a representative of the organisation, said the media advisor of Sulabh International Madan Jha. He further added that some women have tied a rakhi to the PM previously.

156.title: Consumer prices in US unchanged in July due to fall in gasoline cost
156.article_body: The US consumer price index was unchanged in July, the Labor Department said on Wednesday, compared with the 1.3% gain in the prior month. This comes amid fall in gasoline prices. Economists polled by The Wall Street Journal had estimated a 0.2% advance in July. Energy prices fell 4.6% in July, with gasoline prices down 7.7%.

157.title: Those believing in black magic won’t earn people's trust: PM on Cong
157.article_body: Referring to the Opposition's protest in black dresses on August 5, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said those who believe in black magic will never be able to earn the trust of people. "Even after repeatedly spreading lies against the government, the public is not ready to trust such people," PM Modi further said.

158.title: CEO's crying selfie on LinkedIn after firing employees goes viral, sparks debate
158.article_body: Braden Wallake, CEO of HyperSocial, posted a photo of himself crying while trying to explain why he had to fire some of his employees. Calling it the "most vulnerable thing" he'll ever share, Wallake wrote on LinkedIn, "I can't...think of...a lower moment than this." While some appreciated Wallake, others criticised him and wrote, "The post...would've done well without the picture."

159.title: G20 summit is opportunity to introduce 'Brand UP' to world: CM Yogi
159.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday termed next year's G20 summit, which will be held in India, as an opportunity to introduce 'Brand UP' to the world. According to an official release, CM Adityanath has directed officials to prepare a comprehensive action plan for summit. "We have to...present the cultural, spiritual, social, economic and industrial characteristics of [UP]," he said.

160.title: Bat coronaviruses infect 66,000 people each year, pose pandemic risk: Study
160.article_body: As per a study, bat coronaviruses infect thousands of people every year in Southeast Asia, posing a risk of pandemic. "Our estimate that...approx 66,000 people are infected with SARSr-CoVs each year in Southeast Asia suggests that bat-to-human SARSr-CoV spillover is common in the region...[it's] undetected by surveillance programs and clinical studies in...majority of cases," the study stated.

161.title: 36-yr-old bike rider dies as electric pole falls on him in Palghar
161.article_body: Yogesh Pagdhare, a 36-year-old contractual employee, died after an unmaintained electric pole fell on him while he was riding his bike to work in Tarapur MIDC industrial area. Pagdhare died after passersby took him to the hospital and his condition began deteriorating. The pole is in shabby condition from its bottom and no concrete support was maintained, local residents said.

162.title: Rajapaksa wants to visit country, he isn't seeking asylum: Thailand
162.article_body: Thailand's Foreign Ministry on Wednesday confirmed it has received a request for ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to visit the country, adding that he isn't seeking asylum. Thailand has no problem with Rajapaksa entering on a diplomatic passport, which would allow him to stay 90 days, ministry spokesman Tanee Sangrat said. Rajapaksa is currently in Singapore on short-term visa pass.

163.title: Can I abuse?: Vidya Balan to people who say 'actresses have short shelf life'
163.article_body: In a recent video, actress Vidya Balan listed 'ridiculous things' female actors get told that male actors don't. Her list included comments like "actresses have...short shelf life", "your role is...important. You play...catalyst in...hero's journey", and "at this point in your career...rate race doesn't matter" among others, reacting to which Vidya is heard saying, "Can I abuse?" in the video.

164.title: Ishan Kishan shares 'hate leke badal jaunga' song on Instagram after Asia Cup 2022 snub
164.article_body: After being excluded from India's squad for the upcoming Asia Cup, wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan shared a portion of the song 'Humble Poet' on his Instagram Stories. "Meri baat sun mai hate deke kahan jaaunga...yaa fir aisa kahun hate leke badal jaunga," the part of the song read. Notably, Ishan is India's second-highest run-scorer in T20Is this year.

165.title: Joe Biden 'forgets' he already shook hands with Senator, reaches out again; video viral
165.article_body: A video went viral showing US President Joe Biden appearing to have forgotten that he already shook hands with Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer during signing ceremony for CHIPS and Science Act of 2022. In the video, Biden can be seen shaking hands with Schumer and then reaching out for handshake again seconds later while Schumer was shaking others' hands.

166.title: China's geostrategic ambitions go beyond Taiwan: Taiwanese minister
166.article_body: Taiwan's Foreign Minister Joseph Wu on Tuesday said that China's "geostrategic ambitions" go well beyond Taiwan. All freedom-loving countries should work together to respond to the "expansion of authoritarianism", he added. The comments come after China launched military drills around Taiwan in response to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's recent visit to the self-governed island.

167.title: Nitish in front row of Oppn along with Mamata to end Modi raj: Shatrughan
167.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar stands in the "front row" of the Opposition camp, along with Mamata Banerjee, to end the "Modi raj" in the country, TMC MP Shatrughan Sinha said on Wednesday. Sinha said that Nitish Kumar has given the BJP a taste of its own medicine, after it dislodged the governments of Opposition parties in Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra.

168.title: Threw ink at Rakesh Tikait to become famous: Accused to K'taka Police
168.article_body: Bharath Shetty, who along with his three associates, threw black ink at Bhartiya Kisan Union leader Rakesh Tikait during a press conference in Bengaluru on May 30, told police that they did so to become famous. Shetty told police that they were originally planning to throw rotten tomatoes and eggs at Tikait. Throwing ink was their plan B, police said.

169.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹3.54 lakh under pretext of online sales job
169.article_body: A 43-year-old jobless woman in Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹3.54 lakh by a cyber-fraudster, who contacted her through text message and offered her a sales job. The accused informed the woman that he works for an online shopping platform and persuaded the woman to spend money on face creams, t-shirts, shoes, phones, bracelets and other items.

170.title: Drug addict husband assaults, urinates on wife's head in B'luru
170.article_body: The Karnataka police have lodged an FIR against a drug addict husband on charges of urinating on his wife's head under the influence of drugs in Bengaluru, police said on Wednesday. The accused partied with his friends at home and physically assaulted his wife in front of them whenever she raised an objection, police said.

171.title: BJP workers break barriers, manhandle guards & priests at MP temple: Reports
171.article_body: A scuffle broke out inside Madhya Pradesh's Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain on Wednesday. As per reports, workers belonging to BJP's Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha broke the temple's barricades after being denied entry into the sanctum sanctorum. They manhandled police, guards and priests who tried to stop them, reports added. This happened during BJP MP Tejasvi Surya's visit to the temple.

172.title: PIL before Delhi HC seeks to declare Satyendar Jain as man with ‘unsound mind’
172.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation has been filed before the Delhi HC seeking to declare AAP leader Satyendar Jain, arrested in a money laundering case, a "person with an unsound mind". The PIL also seeks to disqualify him as an MLA and Minister. The petitioner, in his plea, said that Jain declared before the ED that he lost his memory.

173.title: Govt removes fare caps on tickets of domestic flights from August 31
173.article_body: Government has decided to remove fare caps on tickets of domestic airlines from August 31. The airfare caps were imposed on domestic airlines in 2020 during the coronavirus pandemic.
