"But this entire situation that I am being constantly being pulled into is not even being remotely my circus," she wrote. "If beating me down helps you channelize your hurt I'm happy to help. Carry on and god bless you all," she added.

350.title: Mumbai Police to launch initiative to reunite missing children with families
350.article_body: The Mumbai Police will launch 'Operation Reunited', an initiative to reunite missing or abducted children with their families. The 'Operation Reunited' will start from August 15 (Independence Day) and go on till September 15, an official said. The police have also appealed to people to inform them on helpline numbers 100 or 1098 about children found in suspicious conditions.

351.title: 16 of 26 sewage plants in Delhi do not meet quality parameters: Study
351.article_body: A Delhi Pollution Control Committee report has found that 16 of 26 sewage treatment plants in the national capital do not meet the Central Pollution Control Board's quality parameters. Nilothi, Najafgarh and New Kondli plants have been found to be the worst performers, breaching the standards set for each parameter by two to six times, the report added.

352.title: Expanding Delhi sewage system crucial to clean Yamuna: Jal Board
352.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board has said that expanding the sewage system in the city is crucial to cleaning the Yamuna. The Delhi government had announced that it would clean the river by 2025 and the Jal Board has constructed 24 weirs and check-dams on the Najafgarh drain as part of the project. The Board held a review meeting on Monday.

353.title: F1 driver Ricciardo wants $21-million payout to leave McLaren: Reports
353.article_body: F1 driver Daniel Ricciardo wants a $21-million payout to end his multi-year contract with the McLaren F1 team at the end of 2022, reports said. This comes as various reports claimed McLaren want to replace Ricciardo with F2 champion Oscar Piastri. Ricciardo, an eight-time F1 race winner, joined McLaren at the start of the 2021 season on a three-year contract.

354.title: Tiger Woods motivated me to play tennis again: Serena Williams
354.article_body: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams revealed that it was golfer Tiger Woods who motivated her to play tennis again after she was sidelined for a year due to injury. She said she spoke to her "friend" Woods, who told her to try getting back to the sport in "short spurts". Serena spoke of this while announcing her retirement.

355.title: Former Real Madrid midfielder Isco joins Sevilla on a free transfer
355.article_body: After nine years of playing for Real Madrid, Spanish midfielder Isco has joined their La Liga rivals, Sevilla. The 30-year-old free agent signed a two-year contract with the team that will start their league campaign at Osasuna on Friday. Current Sevilla manager Julen Lopetegui has earlier coached the attacking midfielder in Real Madrid and the Spanish national team.

356.title: Shake It Off lyrics were written by me: Swift on plagiarism lawsuit
356.article_body: Singer Taylor Swift responded to the plagiarism lawsuit against her song 'Shake It Off'. The singer said, "The lyrics to ‘Shake It Off’ were written entirely by me." Taylor was sued by 'Playas Gon' Play' songwriters for her song's chorus. In her declaration, she said she never heard 'Playas Gon' Play' song or of the group 3LW before the claim.

357.title: US' Antony Blinken meets South African Prez as part of Africa tour
357.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met South African President Cyril Ramaphosa at an airforce base in Centurion on Tuesday. Blinken, who is on a three-nation tour of Africa, later left for Congo. In his South Africa visit, Blinken launched the US' engagement policy with sub-Saharan African countries, calling the region a "major geopolitical force".

358.title: Israeli troops kill 3 Palestinian militants in occupied West Bank
358.article_body: Israeli forces killed three Palestinian militants and injured dozens in a shootout during an arrest raid in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday. The Israeli military said troops were attacked by Palestinians throwing stones and explosives at them and that the soldiers retaliated with live fire. The shootout follows intense clashes over the weekend in the Gaza Strip.

359.title: Alleged terrorist planning attack on Independence Day arrested in UP
359.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested an alleged terrorist with ties to the Islamic State on Tuesday after interrogating him in Lucknow. Sabauddin Azmi was planning an attack on Independence Day, an official said. An illegal weapon and materials to make bombs were seized from him, he said. Azmi was booked under sections of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act and Arms Act.

360.title: 1-year-old boy missing after falling into open drain in Punjab
360.article_body: A year-old boy fell into an open drain in Punjab's Kapurthala on Tuesday and rescue operations are on to save him, police said. The boy Abhilash and his four-year-old sister were crossing the drain by walking over a cement pole kept on it, when he slipped and fell. The boy's mother jumped into the drain but failed to find him.

361.title: Ukrainian guerrillas threaten Russian control in occupied regions
361.article_body: Russia's plan to hold referendums in regions under its control in southeast Ukraine has been threatened by guerrilla forces loyal to Kyiv, Associated Press reported on Tuesday. The resistance against Kremlin has killed pro-Moscow officials and destroyed trains and bridges being used by Russia for supplies. Further, the guerrilla forces have helped the Ukrainian military by locating key targets.

362.title: Assam Rifles officer injured as gunmen open fire in Arunachal
362.article_body: A Junior Commissioned Officer of Assam Rifles was injured after suspected militants opened fire at a patrolling team near the India-Myanmar border in Arunachal Pradesh on Tuesday. Troops were undertaking enhanced patrolling ahead of Independence Day when the shooting occurred from across the border, an official said. ULFA (I) and NSCN (K-YA) are suspected to have carried out the attack.

363.title: Rockets fired by Gaza militants killed 14 Palestinians: Israel
363.article_body: At least 14 Palestinians were killed by rockets fired by militants of Gaza as it clashed with Israeli forces over the weekend, the Israeli military has said. In the attacks, 47 Palestinians were killed, Israel said, claiming 200 rockets fired by the militants fell in Palestinian territory. Israel claimed victory over the clashes saying it killed two Islamic Jihad commanders.

364.title: Punjab logs 406 fresh COVID-19 cases, 7 deaths reported
364.article_body: Punjab reported 406 new cases of COVID-19 and seven deaths due to the infection on Tuesday, a medical bulletin said. Tuesday's fresh cases took the state's active case tally to 2,841, news agency PTI reported. According to the bulletin, two of the seven fatalities recorded in the state were from Mohali. Barnala, Jalandhar, Ludhiana and Rupnagar reported one death each.

365.title: National flags worth ₹16 cr sold in Assam ahead of Independence Day
365.article_body: National flags worth ₹16.07 crore have been sold in Assam so far ahead of Independence Day and 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "Over 53 lakh Tiranga have been sold [in Assam]...20 lakh from Fair Price Shops and 33 lakh from [Assam State Rural Livelihood Mission]." Self-help groups have stitched 35,95,167 national flags in Assam.

366.title: 37 arrested in raid by anti-narcotics team of police in Shillong
366.article_body: Anti-narcotics team of police in Shillong conducted a raid in the city's Polo Bazar area on Tuesday and arrested 37 individuals, 27 of whom were drug users, an official informed. Banned substances including heroin weighing 8.97 gm, 20 nitrazepam tablets and 286.93 gm of cannabis were seized during the raids, the official added.

367.title: Films are meant to spread love, not meant to be cancelled: Kareena
367.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan has said the cancel and boycott culture "upsets" and "saddens" her. Talking about the efforts that went behind making 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Kareena said films are meant "to spread love and positivity". She added, "It's not meant to kind of be cancelled or spoken about in that sense and it upsets me."

368.title: Considered hypnotherapy to forget Lord of the Rings trilogy: Director
368.article_body: 'Lord of the Rings' (LOTR) director Peter Jackson called himself an "unlucky person" as he couldn’t enjoy the trilogy like an audience member. He said he "did seriously consider" hypnotherapy as he wished to forget the films and his years of work on them to be able to enjoy them. However, he admitted he didn't go through with the plan.

369.title: What is the issue: Chopra questions India picking 3 pacers for Asia Cup
369.article_body: After only three full-time pacers were named in the Indian squad for the upcoming Asia Cup tournament, former cricketer Aakash Chopra questioned the move by saying, "What is the issue?" "There is a lot of grass on the [Dubai] pitch...There is consistent help for the fast bowlers. We saw that in the IPL," Chopra said.

370.title: I've never set out to play these many games: Pollard on playing 600 T20s
370.article_body: Commenting on becoming the first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history, West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard said, "It's an achievement in itself, 600 games in any format." He added, "I've never set out to play these many games." Pollard achieved this feat while playing for London Spirit at the ongoing The Hundred tournament at Lord's on Monday.

371.title: 3 suspected members of militant group NNC arrested in Assam
371.article_body: Three suspected militants of the Naga National Council (NNC) have been arrested from Assam's Cachar district over the last 24 hours, police said on Tuesday. Two of the three suspects were arrested from Shib Colony area of Silchar town on Monday, police added. On the basis of information provided by them, the third individual was arrested from Jirighat area.

372.title: Filled with gratitude on another CWG: Sharath on 4 medals in Birmingham
372.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal said he's filled with gratitude and happiness on his participation in another Commonwealth Games. He added that CWG 2022 was his best one. The 40-year-old won four medals, including three golds, in Birmingham. Sharath made his debut at CWG 2006 in Melbourne. Sharath and boxer Nikhat Zareen were the flag-bearers at the closing ceremony.

373.title: Now our govt is formed; everyone will get employment: RJD's Tej Pratap
373.article_body: After JD(U) broke its alliance with BJP on Tuesday, RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav said that "now our government has been formed, everyone will get employment". "Now everything is up to the people, if the people want, they will get rid of BJP's fever in 2 minutes. We will accept whatever we get," Yadav said.

374.title: MS Dhoni said 'Fielding and running between wickets are non-negotiable for me': R Sridhar
374.article_body: Talking about MS Dhoni's captaincy style, former India fielding coach R Sridhar said, "MS...when he was captain, he led the fielding. And the running between the wickets was to me, an eye opener." He added, "MS said, 'Two things that are non-negotiable for me are fielding and running between the wickets'. And that is something which still holds true."

375.title: Female tourist dies after drowning in sea in Odisha's Puri
375.article_body: A female tourist died from drowning on Tuesday in Odisha's Puri after a strong wave swept away three friends taking a bath in the sea. The woman was declared dead when she was taken to a hospital after being pulled out of the sea. The incident took place around 11 am near the Digabareni area of Blue Flag beach.

376.title: Stones hurled during Muharram procession in UP after row over DJ
376.article_body: Members of two communities hurled stones at each other during Muharram procession in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly on Tuesday. Police said people from the Hindu community  complained about the use of a DJ in the procession and hurled stones at those participating in the procession. They complained that a "new tradition" was being set with the use of DJ, police added.

377.title: Thai PM Prayut to stay in power for another 2 years, says Dy PM
377.article_body: Thai PM Prayut Chan-o-cha will be in power for two more years, Deputy PM Prawit Wongsuwan said on Tuesday. This comes as the main opposition party seeks a court ruling to remove the PM this month, a year before an election is due. Prayut can serve a maximum of eight years as the PM as per the country's Constitution.

378.title: N Korea ready to send 100,000 troops to participate in Ukraine war: Russian expert
378.article_body: Around 100,000 North Korean volunteers are ready to go to Russia and take part in the Ukraine war, Russian military expert Igor Korotchenko said recently on state TV. North Korean builders are ready to work alongside Russian builders to repair war damage, Korotchenko added. He said the troops are "resilient, undemanding and motivated".

379.title: I had no strength, it was one of the toughest moments: Hamilton on Abu Dhabi controversy
379.article_body: Lewis Hamilton, who had finished second in F1 2021 season after Max Verstappen defeated him in the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix following a controversy, said, "I do remember just sitting there in disbelief." "I had no strength. And it was one of the toughest moments, I would say, that I've had in a long, long time," he added.

380.title: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' becomes 5th Marvel film to earn ₹100 cr in India
380.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Thor: Love and Thunder', starring Chris Hemsworth, Christian Bale and Natalie Portman, has become the fifth Marvel film to earn more than ₹100 crore at Indian box office. It is also the second Hollywood film after 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' to cross ₹100 crore this year in India. The film was released on July 7.

381.title: Was offered a role in 'Top Gun: Maverick' with Tom: Lewis Hamilton
381.article_body: Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton revealed that he was offered a role in the Tom Cruise-starrer 'Top Gun: Maverick'. "Cruise invited me to his set...when he was doing 'Edge of Tomorrow' and then we [gradually became friends]," Hamilton said. He added that declining the offer was "the most upsetting call that I think I've ever had [to take]".

382.title: Nitish's move driven by desire to run for PM in 2024: Chirag Paswan
382.article_body: LJP (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan on Tuesday said that Nitish Kumar's decision to sever ties with the BJP was driven by his "selfish desire" to run for PM in 2024. "I want to tell the parties which are now joining hands with Nitish Kumar that very soon, he will betray them as well and ruin their future," Paswan said.

383.title: Let's renew vow to defend freedom: Sonia on Quit India anniversary
383.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday urged citizens to defend India's freedom with "all our might" on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the Quit India Movement. "Let us not forget the price that millions...paid for India's freedom," she said. Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said the people should take a 'Unite India' pledge to develop the country.

384.title: China confirms outbreak of new Langya virus, 35 people found infected
384.article_body: A new type of animal-derived Henipavirus named Langya has been detected in China's Shandong and Henan provinces, the state media reported. So far the virus has infected 35 people causing symptoms like fever, fatigue, cough, anorexia, nausea, vomiting etc. As per reports, the virus may also cause kidney and liver failure and is likely transmitted from animals to humans.

385.title: Massive cliff collapses onto a beach in UK, pic goes viral
385.article_body: A series of cliffs collapsed along the Devon coast in UK on Monday amid heatwave. The cliffs collapsed at Sidmouth and East Beach. The collapse of the Sidmouth cliff was the result of a second major landslide along the Jurassic Coast in two weeks. Temperatures have caused cracks in the rocks causing them to collapse.

386.title: Alia shot a scene like a pro despite being ill, everyone clapped: Darlings maker
386.article_body: 'Darlings' director Jasmeet K Reen recalled how Alia Bhatt filmed a crucial scene in the film while she was sick. "Alia was ill one day, but she still came for...shoot...We rolled...camera and she gave her take like a pro," Jasmeet said, adding, "The entire set stood and clapped, not because she was unwell, but because they loved what she did."

387.title: Naxal arrested after encounter in Chhattisgarh, arms & ammunition seized
387.article_body: An injured suspected Naxalite was arrested and a huge cache of arms and ammunition was seized after an encounter with the security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, a police official said on Tuesday. After the encounter, an SLR (self-loading rifle) with 29 live cartridges, an INSAS rifle with four live cartridges, explosives and Maoist literature were recovered, the official added.

388.title: Want to see Arshad and Neeraj in packed Pak stadium: Pak coach
388.article_body: Pakistani javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem's coach Syed Hussain Bukhari said he wants to see the athlete compete with Neeraj Chopra in a "packed stadium" in Lahore or Islamabad. "Neeraj is like our son. If Neeraj wins, we'll shower him with the same love as Milkha Singh Ji," he added. Arshad, during CWG 2022, broke the Games record to win gold.

389.title: AIADMK's first MP Maya Thevar passes away at the age of 87
389.article_body: AIADMK's first MP K Maya Thevar passed away on Tuesday due to cardiac arrest in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul at the age of 87. Thevar was handpicked by AIADMK founder MG Ramachandran to contest the party's maiden by-election in 1973. Condoling his death, former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam said, "It was he who selected the two leaves symbol for [AIADMK]."

390.title: 300 cooperatives onboarded as buyers on Centre's GeM portal
390.article_body: The onboarding of cooperatives as buyers on the Centre's Government e-Marketplace (GeM) was launched by Union Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday. Over 300 cooperatives have registered as buyers on the public procurement portal, Shah announced. Registering as buyers will give these cooperatives access to goods and services at competitive prices, an official statement said.

391.title: Assam & Meghalaya to hold border talks after Aug 15: CM Sangma
391.article_body: Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma on Tuesday said that his government will hold talks with Assam's government to resolve the remaining six areas of dispute at the inter-state border after August 15. "We will be meeting in Guwahati," he added. Regional committees will be formed to take the process forward for the second phase of the border talks, he further said.

392.title: He had affairs with 8 women while dating me, always wanted sex: Giggs' ex to court
392.article_body: Ex-Manchester United footballer Ryan Giggs, who's on trial after being accused of physically assaulting his ex-girlfriend Kate Greville, had affairs with eight women while he was dating Greville, a court heard. Greville told the court Giggs had "full-on relationship" with the eight women. She stated that Giggs "always wanted sex", adding that she felt he was using her for sex.

393.title: It's my wedding date, don't want fans to imitate it: Naga on his tattoo
393.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya has shared the meaning behind his arm tattoo and said it's a Morse code for his wedding date. He also asked his fans to stop imitating his tattoo. "This isn't something you would want to imitate...I feel...bad when they tattoo these things," he said. Naga and Samantha got married in 2017 and announced their separation in 2021.

394.title: I'm very nervous about 'Laal...', haven't slept for over 48 hrs: Aamir
394.article_body: Ahead of the release of his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actor Aamir Khan in an interview said, "I'm very nervous right now, it's been over 48 hours I've not slept." "My brain is in overdrive, so I read books or play chess online," he added. Aamir further said he will sleep peacefully after the release of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

395.title: Palestinians in West Bank to start flying from Israeli airport to Turkey
395.article_body: Palestinians from the occupied West Bank will be offered special flights from Ramon Airport near Israel's Eilat to Turkey, Israel's Airports Authority said on Tuesday. Palestinians in occupied territories can't fly from Israel's Ben Gurion Airport without special permission and often travel to Jordan to catch international flights. Notably, these flights won't be offered to Palestinians from Gaza.

396.title: Parliament panel seeks 1 adoption law for all including LGBT+ people
396.article_body: A Parliamentary panel report has called for a new law to make adoptions inclusive of all religions and the LGBTQIA+ community. The panel said such legislation should be more transparent, accountable and less bureaucratic. The recommendations further called for consonance between the Hindu Adoptions and Maintenance Act and the Juvenile Justice Act to make the process easier.

397.title: China, S Korea pledge to develop closer ties amid tensions in region
397.article_body: The Foreign Ministers of South Korea and China on Tuesday pledged to develop closer relations and maintain stable industrial supply chains. Notably, this comes amid tensions between the US and China over Taiwan. South Korea, a longtime US ally, is struggling to strike a balance between America and the increasingly assertive foreign policy of China, a report said.

398.title: K'taka govt planning construction of dams on Mahadayi river: Goa Cong
398.article_body: The Goa Congress claimed that Karnataka was planning to construct dams on Mahadayi river in violation of a Supreme Court order. A delegation led by Goa Congress chief Amit Patkar met Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai and sought his intervention. "We submitted a memorandum stating that people in Goa are...concerned about the failure of Goa government...to protect Mahadayi river," Patkar said.

399.title: Central Vista area for new PM's Office yet to receive clearance
399.article_body: The Central Vista's Executive Enclave, which will house the new Prime Minister's Office and Cabinet Secretariat, is yet to be cleared by the Delhi State Environment Impact Assessment Authority. A committee vetting the proposal had raised concerns over an "excessively high proportion" of tree removal from the site. The CPWD revised its proposal to comply with new rules.

400.title: Ramya Krishnan to shoot for Rajinikanth's 'Jailer' from Aug 10
400.article_body: Actress Ramya Krishnan revealed that she will start shooting for Rajinikanth's 'Jailer' from August 10 onwards. She said she is "very excited" about the film. As per the reports, the cast will be shooting for a special promo. The full-fledged shoot of the film will begin post August 15. Ramya had previously worked with Rajinikanth in 'Padikkathavan' and 'Padaiyappa'.

401.title: Sensitise officers handling human trafficking cases: Centre to HCs
401.article_body: The Home Ministry has ordered all High Courts (HCs) to organise a conference to sensitise judicial officers to deal with human trafficking-related matters. The government said it has noticed officers lacking awareness and training to handle such situations, leading to ineffective investigations. As per Central government data for 2020, there were 1,714 registered human trafficking cases in India.

402.title: AI Express crash survivors to build hospital for rescuers in Kerala
402.article_body: The survivors and families of those who died in Air India Express flight crash at Kerala's Calicut International Airport in 2020 have raised ₹50 lakh to build a hospital building for locals who had carried out rescue operations following the crash. The building will be constructed for a Public Health Centre, the only government health facility near the crash site.
